description: R-based graphical tool to concisely visualise and compare biological annotations queried from the DAVID web service.
name: BACA

metadata.abstract: © 2015 Fortino et al.Background: DAVID is the most popular tool for interpreting large lists of gene/proteins classically produced in high-throughput experiments. However, the use of DAVID website becomes difficult when analyzing multiple gene lists, for it does not provide an adequate visualization tool to show/compare multiple enrichment results in a concise and informative manner. Result: We implemented a new R-based graphical tool, BACA (Bubble chArt to Compare Annotations), which uses the DAVID web service for cross-comparing enrichment analysis results derived from multiple large gene lists. BACA is implemented in R and is freely available at the CRAN repository (http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/BACA/). Conclusion: The package BACA allows R users to combine multiple annotation charts into one output graph by passing DAVID website.
metadata.title: BACA: Bubble chArt to compare annotations
